Dear IA-Team,

this idea might seem rather strange, but still this is somet=
hing I'm
considering usefull...

So here is the basic idea:
 - I have a Que=
ueTotalBudget set to lets say 10000 entries
 - whilest crawling stuff from =
this queue it grows to a size of
something like 200000 entries (something I=
've seen quite often)
 - after the budget is exceeded the queue gets retire=
d

Result: 190000 entries in the queue that won't ever be used.

Now there =
is one thing I know for sure (which might not be true in
other peoples craw=
ling scenarios): I will not change the queues total
budget - so there is no=
 need to recall any of those URLs. So one
possible approach would be wiping=
 the queue when the budget is exceeded.

But I do see another option that m=
ight be better:
Why enqueue this stuff when we allready do know things will=
 never be
processed?

So my question(s) are: 
 - is this 2nd approach reaso=
nable at all?
 - does writing a postProcessor for such a task seem the righ=
t thing
to do? (which can decided things are out-of-scope if their queues
b=
udget would be exceeded after their addition)

Any thoughts/comments are we=
lcome.

Regards
  Olaf Freyer
